did.abstract: Letter from Andrew H. Hunter to William Beale; and a letter to General Andrew Hunter from a clerk who considered himself underpaid.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Hunter family letters, 1844, 1847, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Andrew H. Hunter was a lawyer and Whig politician. General Andrew Hunter was Marshal of the District of Columbia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letter from Andrew H. Hunter to William Beale; and a letter to General Andrew Hunter from a clerk who considered himself underpaid.
